jdxi_editor.log package

Submodules

jdxi_editor.log.adsr module

Log ADSR Parameter

jdxi_editor.log.adsr.log_adsr_parameter(umb: int, lmb: int, param: AddressParameter, value: int, level: int = 20) → None[source]

Log slider parameters for debugging.

Parameters:

  • umb – int The UMB

  • lmb – int The LMB

  • param – AddressParameter The parameter

  • value – int The value

  • level – int The log level

Returns:

None

jdxi_editor.log.debug_info module

jdxi_editor.log.debug_info.log_debug_info(successes: list[str], failures: list[str]) → None[source]

Logs debug information about the parsed SysEx data.

Parameters:

  • successes – list[str] – Parameters successfully decoded.

  • failures – list[str] – Parameters that failed decoding.

jdxi_editor.log.decorator.decorate_log_message(message: str, level: int) → str[source]

Adds emoji decoration to a log message based on its content and log level.

Parameters:

  • message – The original log message

  • level – The logging level

Returns:

Decorated log message string

jdxi_editor.log.emoji module

Emoji logger formatter for Python’s logging module. This formatter defines emojis to log messages based on their severity level.

jdxi_editor.log.error module

log message

jdxi_editor.log.error.log_error(message: str, exception: Exception | None = None, level: int = 40, stacklevel=2) → None[source]

Log an error message with emojis based on severity and content keywords.

Parameters:

  • message – str The message to log.

  • exception – Optional [str] error message

  • level – int Logging level (default: logging.ERROR).

  • stacklevel – int sets the stack level to log the message from the caller’s context

Returns:

None

jdxi_editor.log.footer module

log footer message

jdxi_editor.log.footer.log_footer_message(message: str, level: int = 20) → None[source]

Logs a highlighted footer message with separators for visibility.

Parameters:

  • message – The message to log.

  • level – Logging level (default: logging.INFO).

log header message

jdxi_editor.log.header.log_header_message(message: str, level: int = 20) → None[source]

Logs a visually distinct header message with separator lines and emojis.

Parameters:

  • message – The message to log.

  • level – Logging level (default: logging.INFO).

Logs a visually distinct header message with separator lines and emojis.

Parameters:

  • stacklevel

  • silent – bool whether or not to write to the log

  • message – The message to log.

  • level – Logging level (default: logging.INFO).

  • successes – list – Parameters successfully decoded.

  • failures – list – Parameters that failed decoding.

jdxi_editor.log.message module

log message

jdxi_editor.log.message.log_message(message: str, level: int = 20, stacklevel=2, silent=False) → None[source]

Log a message with emojis based on severity and content keywords.

Parameters:

  • stacklevel – int sets the stack level to log the message from the caller’s context

  • message – str The message to log.

  • level – int Logging level (default: logging.INFO).

  • silent – bool

Returns:

None

jdxi_editor.log.midi_info module

jdxi_editor.log.midi_info.log_midi_info(msb: int, lsb: int, pc: int) → None[source]

Log MIDI information in a consistent format.

Parameters:

  • msb – int most significant byte

  • lsb – int least significant byte

  • pc – int program

Returns:

None

jdxi_editor.log.parameter module

parameter.py

jdxi_editor.log.parameter.log_parameter(message: str, parameter: Any, float_precision: int = 2, max_length: int = 300, level: int = 20, silent: bool = False)[source]

Log a structured representation of a parameter with type, formatted value, and optional emoji context.

Parameters:

  • silent – bool suppress the log or not

  • message – str The message to log.

  • parameter – Any The parameter to log.

  • float_precision – int The float precision.

  • max_length – int The max length.

  • level – int The log level.
